commuteFromHotel.instructions: Walk from Shibuya Excel Hotel to Meiji Shrine via Yoyogi Park

commuteToHotel.instructions: Short walk back to hotel from Uobei Shibuya

activity.name: Meiji Shrine
activity.description: Start your day at this serene Shinto shrine surrounded by a tranquil forest.

activity.name: Yoyogi Park Morning Walk
activity.description: A peaceful morning stroll through one of Tokyo's largest parks.

activity.name: Afuri Ramen Harajuku
activity.description: Famous for their yuzu shio (citrus salt) ramen.

activity.name: Takeshita Street Food Tour
activity.description: Explore Harajuku's famous street with crepes, cotton candy, and unique snacks.

commuteFromPrevious.instructions: Walk south from Meiji Shrine through Harajuku

activity.name: Shibuya Crossing & Hachiko
activity.description: Experience the world's busiest pedestrian crossing.

activity.name: Shibuya Sky Observation Deck
activity.description: 360-degree panoramic views of Tokyo from the rooftop.

commuteFromPrevious.instructions: Walk south from Harajuku to Shibuya Station

activity.name: Uobei Shibuya
activity.description: High-tech conveyor belt sushi where you order via tablet.

commuteFromPrevious.instructions: Short walk from Shibuya Crossing

commuteFromHotel.instructions: Take Ginza Line from Shibuya to Asakusa

commuteToHotel.instructions: Take Ginza Line from Asakusa to Shibuya

activity.name: Senso-ji Temple
activity.description: Tokyo's oldest and most significant Buddhist temple.

activity.name: Asakusa Hoppy Street
activity.description: A lively alley filled with izakayas and street food.

activity.name: Unagi (Eel) at Ichimon
activity.description: Traditional grilled eel restaurant near the temple.

activity.name: Tokyo Skytree
activity.description: The tallest structure in Japan at 634m.

activity.name: Sumida River Cruise
activity.description: Scenic boat ride from Asakusa to Odaiba.

commuteFromPrevious.instructions: Take Tobu Skytree Line from Asakusa

activity.name: Soba Noodles at Namiki Yabusoba
activity.description: A 100+ year old soba restaurant.

commuteFromPrevious.instructions: Return to Asakusa via subway

commuteFromHotel.instructions: Take JR Yamanote Line from Shibuya to Akihabara

commuteToHotel.instructions: Take JR Yamanote Line from Shinjuku to Shibuya

activity.name: Akihabara Electric Town
activity.description: Explore Tokyo's electronics and anime district.

activity.name: Maid Cafe Experience
activity.description: A quintessential Akihabara experience.

activity.name: teamLab Planets
activity.description: Immersive digital art museum.

commuteFromPrevious.instructions: Take Yurikamome Line to Toyosu

activity.name: Shinjuku Golden Gai
activity.description: A labyrinth of over 200 tiny bars in narrow alleys.

days.title: Travel Day: Tokyo â†’ Kyoto & Gion District

commuteFromHotel.instructions: Take subway from Kyoto Station to Shijo for Nishiki Market

commuteToHotel.instructions: Take bus from Gion back to Kyoto Station

commuteToStation.instructions: Take JR Yamanote Line from Shibuya to Tokyo Station

commuteFromStation.instructions: Hotel Granvia is directly connected to Kyoto Station

activity.name: Shinkansen to Kyoto
activity.description: Bullet train journey from Tokyo to Kyoto. Enjoy views of Mt. Fuji on clear days!

activity.name: Nishiki Market
activity.description: Kyoto's 400-year-old kitchen. Sample local delicacies.

commuteFromPrevious.instructions: Take subway from Kyoto Station to Shijo

activity.name: Fushimi Inari Shrine
activity.description: Iconic shrine with thousands of vermillion torii gates.

activity.name: Kiyomizu-dera Temple
activity.description: UNESCO World Heritage temple with stunning city views.

commuteFromPrevious.instructions: Take JR Nara Line from Shijo to Inari

activity.name: Gion District Evening Stroll
activity.description: Walk through Kyoto's famous geisha district at dusk.

activity.name: Kaiseki Dinner at Gion Nanba
activity.description: Traditional multi-course Japanese dinner.

commuteFromPrevious.instructions: Take JR back to Kyoto, then bus to Gion

commuteFromHotel.instructions: Take JR Sagano Line from Kyoto Station to Saga-Arashiyama

commuteToHotel.instructions: Take bus from Pontocho back to Kyoto Station

activity.name: Arashiyama Bamboo Grove
activity.description: Ethereal bamboo forest path. Best visited at sunrise.

tradeoffs: Early start required for best experience

activity.name: Tenryu-ji Temple
activity.description: UNESCO World Heritage Zen temple with stunning garden.

commuteFromPrevious.instructions: Short walk from Bamboo Grove

activity.name: Tofu Cuisine at Sagano
activity.description: Traditional Kyoto-style tofu kaiseki in a riverside setting.

commuteFromPrevious.instructions: Walk from Tenryu-ji

activity.name: Kinkaku-ji (Golden Pavilion)
activity.description: Iconic Zen temple covered in gold leaf.

activity.name: Ryoan-ji Temple
activity.description: Famous Zen rock garden.

commuteFromPrevious.instructions: Take bus 11 from Arashiyama to Kinkaku-ji

activity.name: Pontocho Alley Dining
activity.description: Atmospheric dining alley along the Kamo River.

commuteFromPrevious.instructions: Take bus from Kinkaku-ji to Shijo-Kawaramachi

days.title: Travel Day: Kyoto â†’ Osaka & Dotonbori

commuteFromHotel.instructions: Take Midosuji Line from Shinsaibashi to Osaka Station

commuteToHotel.instructions: Short walk back to hotel from Dotonbori

commuteToStation.instructions: Walk from Hotel Granvia to Kyoto Station (directly connected)

commuteFromStation.instructions: Take Midosuji Line from Osaka/Umeda Station to Shinsaibashi (Cross Hotel)

activity.name: Train to Osaka
activity.description: Quick JR Special Rapid train from Kyoto to Osaka.

activity.name: Osaka Castle
activity.description: Iconic castle and museum with panoramic city views.

activity.name: Kuromon Market
activity.description: Osaka's Kitchen - fresh seafood, street food, and more.

commuteFromPrevious.instructions: Take Chuo Line to Namba

activity.name: Shinsekai & Tsutenkaku Tower
activity.description: Retro entertainment district with iconic tower.

activity.description: Japan's oldest officially administered temple.

activity.description: Neon-lit food paradise. Try takoyaki, okonomiyaki, and more!

days.title: Day Trip to Nara & Final Evening

commuteToHotel.instructions: Take Midosuji Line from Umeda to Shinsaibashi

activity.description: Meet the friendly deer and explore Japan's first permanent capital.

activity.name: Umeda Sky Building Sunset
activity.description: Floating Garden Observatory with stunning sunset views.

activity.description: Explore the local bars of Umeda or return to Namba.

matchReasons: Great way to end the trip

commuteFromPrevious.instructions: Return to Osaka via Kintetsu Line to Namba, then Midosuji Line to Umeda

generalTips: Get a JR Pass for the Shinkansen and JR trains - saves money on Tokyo-Kyoto-Osaka route
Get a Suica or ICOCA card for easy transit payments
Download Google Maps offline for each city
Most shops accept credit cards, but keep Â¥10,000-20,000 cash for small vendors
Book teamLab Planets at least 1 week in advance
Cherry blossom season (late March - early April) requires earlier bookings
Temple visits are best in early morning to avoid crowds
Many restaurants are cash-only, especially traditional ones
Convenience stores (7-Eleven, Lawson, FamilyMart) have great food and ATMs
